member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Foundation.WPARAM
member.summary: A WPARAMis an unsigned integer type used to pass message-specific information to or from a window procedure.
member.remarks:
The WPARAM type is typically used to hold message parameters that are either numeric values or handles, depending on the message being sent. Its interpretation depends on the message ID.
On 64-bit Windows, WPARAM is defined as an unsigned 64-bit integer (UINT_PTR). On 32-bit Windows, it is an unsigned 32-bit integer (UINT).
This type is declared in WinDef.h as follows: typedef UINT_PTR WPARAM;
Typically paired with when processing window messages.
